Description: Marl pottery jar with small flat base, ovoid body, two pierced tubular handles and flat ledge rim; exterior decorated in red-purple paint with two rows of spirals with diagonal wavy lines between, and wavy lines over and on the handles. A spiral is painted on the base, rim top decorated with wavy line broken into three segments.
Curator's comments: Similar to Decorated ware D32L in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (pl. xxxix) ((tomb register))
